data.title: When was the last time you hugged a hotel staff member?
data.text:
I'd venture to guess "never", but that can be fixed!!!

Ed and Sue were absolutely amazing hosts!  The breakfasts were delicious, and the conversation and welcome arms were absolutely what we needed!

The building itself is a work of art and architecture, built circa 1913 and on the National Registry of Historic Buildings.  Walking into the front entry room you are greeted with a home that most haven't seen outside of the 1930s southern plantations.

The B&B is located about 6 miles from Texas A&M, which means even on super busy game weekends there is little traffic, yet it is a quick drive to get to campus.  The rooms are quiet, but when you walk occasionally the floor creaks in the way that only a 100 year old home, on all its glory and nostalgia, can.

If you're an early riser, and lucky enough, you can play "guess what's for breakfast" while the delicious aromas waft upwards from the kitchen on the ground floor.

This B&B has been a "well kept secret" by many, and some guests have been making regular stays for over a decade.  A commitment like that should tell you how marvelous the stay is!

On a personal note: while we were visiting, our daughter was locked out of her apartment.  While waiting for the roommate to get off work, Ed and Sue welcomed her into their home as well, and made what could have been a long afternoon sitting outside a pleasant stay indoors.  Thanks so much!!

owner_response.author: SueSeale, Owner at Victory Rose Bed and Breakfast, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your great review of Victory Rose Bed and Breakfast.  We truly enjoyed having you stay with us.  We look forward to your return.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Victory Rose Bed and Breakfast Bryan, Texas
data.text:
This place has got to be one of the best kept secrets in town. My husband and I stayed at the Victory Rose May 9-11, 2014 to attend our daughter's graduation form A & M. The house is perfectly decorated and the wicker rocking chairs on the huge from porch just beg to be rockrd
in. Everything was available from luscious bath robes to coffee in your room. The breakfasts
were absolutely delicious and Ed and Sue, the owners, invited our graduating daughter to join
us both days free even of any charge. We definitely plan a return visit even though our daughter
won't be there. The room with the fireplace calls for a winter time visit. Do yourself a favor and  check out their web site victoryrosebandb,com. Ed and Sue DON'T raise their rates during special A&M functions like the other hotels do. Check them ou you'll be glad you did

data.title: Great place to stay
data.text: This is our second time to stay at the Victory Rose.  We love it.  Ed and Sue (the owners) are wonderful hosts and always make us feel at home.  Clean, great breakfasts and good value.  Located close to the old downtown area.  Great shopping.
